silhouette.shapes
Class CompositeShape

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--silhouette.constraints.constrainedObject
        |
        +--silhouette.shapes.AbstractSilShape
              |
              +--silhouette.shapes.BoxShape
                    |
                    +--silhouette.shapes.CompositeShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
SilContainer, SilShape
Direct Known Subclasses:
CanvasShape
public class CompositeShape
extends BoxShape
implements SilContainer

CompositeShape is the workhorse of the Silhouette system. A CompositeShape defines a coordinate space in which Shapes are displayed. Shapes are drawn relative to the origin of the composite shape. For example, if a shape has the coordinates (10, 20) and the composite shape has the coordinates (40, 60), then the shape will be drawn at coordinates (50, 80). Shapes can be added to a composite shape using a variety of add methods and can be removed using a variety of remove methods.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
draws the CompositeShape by calling the DisplayManager's display method. This method should never be called directly by an application. To get a composite shape to appear on the screen, either add it to a Silhouette canvas or to a composite shape that has been added to a Silhouette canvas.
Overrides:
draw in class AbstractSilShape
